intro: Eriogonum caryophylloides, commonly known as the redstem buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and grasslands, and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range from pink to red, bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
